supporting_text: The NAP mentions a 'One Health' approach dealing with AMR in humans and livestock mainly.
The NAP includes specific actions in the human health sector, including improving awareness and guidelines for antibiotic use.
The NAP includes actions targeting animal health, such as improving awareness and guidelines for antibiotic use in livestock.
The NAP does not mention specific actions targeting the environment.
The NAP includes actions related to agriculture, such as improving awareness of AMR among farmers and promoting responsible antibiotic use.
The NAP includes a monitoring and evaluation plan to track progress on its objectives.
The NAP outlines specific targets and milestones for various activities over the 5-year period.
The NAP does not specify quantitative targets for AMR prevalence or antimicrobial use.
The NAP mentions that costing of activities could not be finalized due to the lack of an actual budget.
The NAP does not contain an assessment of future budget requirements.
The NAP includes the formation of a National Multi-sectoral Coordination Group (NMCG) for AMR coordination.
The NAP includes activities aimed at empowering the National Medicine Regulatory Authority (NMRA) to strengthen regulations for antimicrobial use.
The NAP targets the inclusion of AMR in educational curricula at all levels, including professional training for healthcare workers.
The NAP includes plans for public awareness campaigns and media involvement to combat AMR.
The NAP mentions collaboration with WHO, FAO, and OIE for AMR initiatives.
The NAP includes plans for establishing surveillance systems and data collection for AMR monitoring.
The NAP includes activities aimed at enhancing capacity for detecting and reporting AMR.
The NAP includes infection prevention and control (IPC) as a major pillar of the AMR control plan.
The NAP includes adherence to international standards and guidelines for AMR control.
The NAP includes activities aimed at regulating the distribution and use of antibiotics.
The NAP includes regulations aimed at promoting the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP includes plans for international collaboration in research related to AMR.
